docs.lead_paragraph: GIVEN the evidence for the ill effects of cigarette smoking on health and appearance and a social climate that all but ostracizes smokers, it is difficult for nonsmokers to understand why anyone continues to smoke. But cigarettes still have a stranglehold on about 46 million Americans, many of whom think they cannot quit or have no desire to try. For many smokers, tobacco is more than a pleasure and more than a drug addiction. It is an antidepressant that helps people concentrate, remember and think more quickly, and for such immediate benefits they are willing to put their health, even their lives, on the line.
